unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Your Guide to the Film Festival Scene (Desi Edition)
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Your Guide to the Film Festival Scene (Desi Edition)

unnormalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinephiles! Ever felt like you needed more than just Friday night movie outings? Well, step into the world of film festivals! They’re like mini-Bollywood Diwali celebrations, but instead of firecrackers, you get back-to-back screenings of indie gems, documentaries, and even world premieres.
normalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinephiles! Ever felt like you needed more than just Friday night movie outings? Well, step into the world of film festivals! They're like mini-Bollywood Diwali celebrations, but instead of firecrackers, you get back-to-back screenings of indie gems, documentaries, and even world premieres.

unnormalised: Think of it as a curated buffet for your eyes. You get to sample films you'd probably *never* find playing at PVR. Plus, the vibe is totally different. You're surrounded by people who are as passionate about cinema as you are – directors, actors, critics, and fellow movie nerds ready to debate the merits of that 3-hour art film you just watched.

You're surrounded by people who are as passionate about cinema as you are – directors, actors, critics, and fellow movie nerds ready to debate the merits of that three-hour art film you just watched.

unnormalised: India’s got a thriving festival scene, from the grand old dame, the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa, to smaller, more niche festivals popping up all over the place. IFFI is a *must* if you want the whole shebang – red carpets, celebrities, awards, the works. Remember when Dev Patel presented an award there in 2008? Epic!
normalised: India's got a thriving festival scene, from the grand old dame, the International Film Festival of India (I F F I) in Goa, to smaller, more niche festivals popping up all over the place. I F F I is a must if you want the whole shebang – red carpets, celebrities, awards, the works. Remember when Dev Patel presented an award there in two thousand and eight? Epic!

unnormalised: And it's not just about the biggies. Places like the Jagran Film Festival, which travels to 16 cities across India covering a distance of roughly 2250 km, bring cinema to smaller towns. Imagine catching a sneak peek of a film before its official release, right in your backyard!
normalised: And it's not just about the biggies. Places like the Jagran Film Festival, which travels to sixteen cities across India covering a distance of roughly two thousand two hundred and fifty kilometer, bring cinema to smaller towns. Imagine catching a sneak peek of a film before its official release, right in your backyard!

unnormalised: Beyond the films, film festivals are networking goldmines. Aspiring filmmakers can connect with established names, maybe even pitch their script. You might even bump into someone from the Film and Television Institute of India (FTII) ready to share some insider knowledge over chai.
normalised: Beyond the films, film festivals are networking goldmines. Aspiring filmmakers can connect with established names, maybe even pitch their script. You might even bump into someone from the Film and Television Institute of India (F T I I) ready to share some insider knowledge over chai.

unnormalised: So, how do you get involved? Simple! Most festivals have websites with schedules and ticketing info. Don't be afraid to dive in! Even if you only understand 50% of a foreign film, the experience is worth it. Plus, you get serious bragging rights later. ;)
normalised: So, how do you get involved? Simple! Most festivals have websites with schedules and ticketing info. Don't be afraid to dive in! Even if you only understand fifty percent of a foreign film, the experience is worth it. Plus, you get serious bragging rights later. Wink.

unnormalised: This year, resolve to ditch your Netflix binge for a weekend and experience the magic of a film festival. You might just discover your next favourite filmmaker (or at least get some awesome Instagram content!). See you at the movies! Maybe I'll even be there, sipping chai and furiously scribbling notes after a screening.
